Perché la strada è ancora molto lunga, per ora siamo una piccola società, non abbiamo una struttura, i macchinari per la produzione, non abbiamo i capitali e nemmeno dipendenti. Facciamo tutto noi 2, dallo sviluppo dei prodotti alla vendita fino al marketing fai da te. Ma abbiamo le cose più importanti: passione, energia e soprattutto le idee. Ed è per questo che oggi siamo sbarcati su Indiegogo per chiedere il vostro aiuto. Quest'anno abbiamo sviluppato due nuovi progetti e ora siamo pronti per mettere in bottiglia SALVIA e TIMO. Come il Basilichito, anche queste sono bibite stupefacenti che creano, con i profumi della tradizione, un'esperienza mai provata prima. La salvia è accompagnata da una lieve nota di arancio mentre per il timo abbiamo scelto la personalità del pompelmo.Qui entrate in gioco voi perché abbiamo bisogno di tutto il vostro supporto. Dobbiamo stampare le etichette, acquistare le materie prime e gli imballaggi, ingaggiare i fornitori e imbottigliare. Non siamo autonomi, ma vogliamo diventarlo e per far questo dobbiamo per forza crescere. Oggi siamo vincolati a dei minimi di produzione molto alti che richiedono l'impiego di altrettante risorse economiche e molto spazio a disposizione per lungo tempo. Con il vostro aiuto invece potremmo non solo avere i fondi subito disponibili ma anche smaltire i prodotti nel giro pochissimi giorni |senza dover affrontare altissimi costi di affitto.



Tutti i nostri sostenitori saranno i primi sulla faccia della terra a ricevere le nostre nuove bibite e gli unici a pagarle fino al 60% in meno rispetto al futuro prezzo di vendita. Inoltre, cosa per noi molto importante e per cui vi saremo sempre grati, potreste essere le persone che un giorno avranno contribuito a realizzare un grande progetto e diventare i protagonisti di un sogno diventato realtà.



Le opzioni d'ordine





























Al termine della campagna (30 Maggio) spediremo gli "Early Bird perks" ossia i primi 100 ordini per ogni PERK entro il 30 Giugno. Tutti gli altri ordini verranno spediti subito dopo, possibilmente prima del 15 Luglio.



Stretch Goals
Abbiamo un paio di colpi in canna nel caso....




Come aggiungere le spese di spedizione e pagare
STEP 1 - Seleziona il tipo di ORDINE in alto a desta in questa pagina.

STEP 2 - Clicca su "CUSTOM" e digita l'importo pari alle spese di spedizione per l'ordine scelto e collegati con il tuo  account Facebook per accedere direttamente oppure scrivi  il tuo indirizzo e-mail per creare un account IndieGoGo.


STEP 3 - Inserisci il tuo nome e il tuo indirizzo negli appositi spazi (è MOLTO importante per noi per sapere dove spedire il tuo ordine!) e finalmente click su "CONTINUE TO PAYMENT"


STEP 4 - Controlla l'importo totale del tuo ordine e clicca su "GO TO PAYPAL" per completare l'acquisto. NOTA BENE: NON E' NECESSARIO AVERE UN CONTO PAYPAL


STEP 5 - Clicca su "PAY with credit or debit card", compila tutti i campi richiesti e poi clicca su "REVIEW and CONTINUE".
Ecco fatto, ora mentre aspetti il 30 Maggio CONDIVIDI IL NOSTRO PROGETTO CON I TUOI AMICI!



Project timeline




Siamo social!
Per favore, PASSA PAROLA e racconta di noi ai tuoi amici! Grazie!

Cercaci su:               



Cos'è il "Programma Referenza"?

Per ogni persona referenziata da te che acquisterà la nostre bibite alla SALVIA e al TIMO ti invieremo un buono sconto del 5% da utilizzare per acquistare sul nostro sito @ www.boreaerossi.it - Ecco come fare:

STEP 1 - Devi utilizzare un computer o un tablet, vai su www.indiegogo.com e accedi con le tue credenziali al tuo account oppure registrati se non hai ancora acquistato prima cliccando su "Sign Up" in alto a destra della pagina.



STEP 2 - Vai in alto a questa pagina e clicca sul pulsante "LINK" sulla sinistra del video. ATTENZIONE: assicurati di aver fatto prima l'accesso al sito.



STEP 3 - Dopo aver cliccato sul pulsante "Link" apparirà una finestra che ti comunicherà che il link di referenza è stato copiato.


STEP 4 - Ora ti basterà incollare il link in un posto sicuro e salvarlo. Dopo di che scrivi un post su Facebook o qualunque altro social media e incolla il link nel post stesso, puoi anche incollarlo su un forum, nei blog o dovunque tu voglia.

Adesso ogni volta che qualcuno dei tuoi amici acquisterà le nostre bibite utilizzando il tuo link di "Referenza" verrà automaticamente tracciato sul tuo account e alla fine della campagna riceverai i buoni sconto del 5%. 1 ogni acquisto effettuato!

Come controllare le tue "referenze":
1. Accedi al tuo account IndieGoGo.
2. Clicca sul tuo nome in alto alla pagina.

3. Seleziona “My Profile”.


4. Clicca su “Referrals” per vedere quanti persone hanno acquistato grazie a te.

5. Inizia a contare quanti buoni sconto riceverai

story:
Short Summary

Hello and thank you for checking out our campaign. 

Big Poppa Creamery & Ice Cream is Central Florida's newest artisan ice cream business. "Big Poppa" is Drew Freeman a born and raised Floridian who understands the critical role ice cream plays during our hot FL days and family night outs. An entrepreneur all his life, Drew has been preparing for the launch of Big Poppa and it is finally time.

This campaign is being run in order to make two critical purchases for the launch of the Big Poppa business. It is finally time to begin full production and to start making appearances at farmers markets and food truck nights all over Central FL.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Ok, here is what we need and why we are reaching out to the community for assistance:

The most critical component we need is also the most expensive. Big Poppa Creamery plans on exclusively using the Emery Thompson brand batch freezer / production machinery. ET machines are built here in FL by American workers with American components. These are the best machines for ice cream production on the planet.

 

  • The next important piece of the business is our trailer/cart. Besides a very small production and sales location, Big Poppa plans on being as active in the community as possible. Through framer's markets, food truck events, corporate activities, etc. Big Poppa will bring his variety of hand crafted artisan  ice creams directly to consumers.

Based on the available funds after the machinery purchase, we will either secure a small mobile cart or full sized pull behind trailer.

 

​

(obviously, these are sample images used as reference, not the actual planned purchase)

  • Any remaining funds above and beyond the 2 major items will be used for raw materials for production.

The Impact

One of the most amazing side-effects of the entrepreneurial boom of the last decade is the growth of artisan craft businesses. What Big Poppa will bring to Orlando and central Florida is handcrafted specialty ice creams reminiscent of the home-made / crafted with love desserts of our past. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can be "Poppa's Pal" or a Platinum donor. There are many other ways you can help if you believe in our mission to bring joy and high-quality ice creams to market.

  • Spread the word- A huge help would be sharing the link and story of Big Poppa with all your friends and contacts. A quick "share" on social media would mean sooo much to us. 
  • Advice/encouragement- a simple note to say hello or to share a few words of advice would let us know we are out here alone.  :)
  • If there is something you would like to share with us or discuss, please feel free to reach out via the campaign, the BigPoppaCreamery.com site, or on social media. We'd love to hear from you.

**If you contribute, please feel free to help with these "extras" as well, we'd love all the help we can get!  Central Florida is such an amazing community and we are excited to becom an active member.**

story:
Short Summary

We are a family from New Zealand who together have over 40 years experience in the fast food and restaurant industry.

Having recently discovered this amazing national Canadian treasure called Poutine and not being able to find it anywhere local our passion for this venture was born. 
We decided that Poutine was a must have addition to the New Zealand street food culture scene and thus together with my wife and mother Something Cheesy was born.

We have the aim to not only bring the "original" Poutine to New Zealand but to also spice it up with different toppings and styles in order to offer variation to the hungry New Zealand market.


By backing Something Cheesy you are helping to bring this idea to life and helping to increase the variation of international cuisine in the street food market of New Zealand. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get Something Cheesy started and completely set up we require $25000 New Zealand Dollars.
This will be spent on the following; 

  • A mobile food truck (including graphics).
  • Government and local permits and regulation certificates.
  • Initial start up supplies.
  • Initial marketing.

If our goal is not reached we will still be going ahead with the idea, however it would be in the form of a "ghost kitchen" with a delivery only concept ran through sources like Uber Eats.

Please see our perks for some great unique perks for backers!!
 

The Impact YOU will have

By backing our business you would be;

  • Helping to create employment
  • Bringing a new food taste sensation to New Zealand 
  • Helping us realize the dream of owning our own business that we can make our passion!

 

Ways you can help us!

We understand if you can't contribute and that's totally fine! Here are some awesome ways you can help us anyway!

  • Share our page on your Facebook or other social media and help spread the word!
  • Tell your friends and family about our start up

story:
My Story

My name is Brittney LaGesse and almost a year ago I decided to take a chance and open a bulk refill store in Boulder, CO. I had limited funds, but for what I lacked in money, I tried to make up for with passion, ambition and flat out hard work. This last year has been a rollercoaster ride filled with excitement, anxiety and uncertainty, but the one true constant has been the overwhelming support and love from this community. I'm not usually one to ask for help, but here goes..

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to take this to the next level. Food packaging waste is one of the hardest things to avoid in our lives. For example, most stores who carry bulk food today still require that you put your goods in plastic bags. We think that's silly and we want to change it - but it won't be easy. 

We're thinking beyond just bulk containers with dry food goods - of course we'll have that :) 

We want to go further and start reshaping the way we think about food packaging, and in turn, influence the people and companies around us to do the same. 

From the storage bins for the various dry goods, oils, etc., renovations to our space, and the scales and systems to make this a seamless and easy experience for every customer, the cost is quickly proving to be more than we can take on ourselves. Whatever you're able to give will be appreciated more than you could possibly know. We have a big goal, but it's a goal that will have an ongoing positive impact on this community and the environment. Oh, and check out the sweet perks for donating on the right ----> 

 

The Impact

Every bit counts. If everyone made a conscious effort to create a little less waste, collectively, we could take a huge step in the right direction. Unfortunately our current infrastructure makes this difficult. There aren't nearly enough bulk stores, especially those carrying food. We hope to enable a community, spread awareness and hopefully inspire others to follow in our footsteps.  

 

The Challenges

Infrastructure

As a society, we're moving quickly in the wrong direction and the only way to drive change is to act. We want to challenge our current infrastructure by supporting businesses who consciously make an effort to provide their goods with less packaging. We will make every effort to carry products from these companies. And if they're local - even better! Consumers have the power. Let's use it. 

 

Education

The single greatest challenge we face is education. The benefit of buying in "bulk" for most people has traditionally been cost savings, and that's it. Saving money is great and we can all agree on that, but this is so much more than a pinching a few pennies here and there. This is about slowing the impact of our waste on this planet. This is about changing our collective mindset to think twice before buying that over-packaged food item. This is about evolving as a society and making a difference together. This only happens with education and this is a BIG part of our mission.

 

It's going to be a long road and one that is sure to come with its fair share of challenges. However, we're motivated, we're excited and we're determined to make it happen. 

Stay tuned into our journey! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, we hope you can share our mission. Educate the people around you. Share this campaign. Share your ideas. And keep being rad. Thanks!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Rowena Riecker. I am an entrepreneur. I have 24 years of experience in business from helping small startups get funding and put in systems to making sure large corporates were accountable for their decisions. I am passionate about people, food, the environment, organic produce, zero waste and want to make a difference in my community.

Earth Mother Organics is currently trading in Durban, South Africa. The café currently serves a vegetarian and vegan menu with breakfasts, lunches, coffees, juices and smoothies among other healthy options. On hearing that the owner is hoping to relocate overseas, I jumped at the opportunity of a lifetime.

By funding in this project you will keep the current staff employed, continue feeding regular customers delicious and healthy vegetarian and vegan foods and drinks. You will also make it possible for this shop to springboard into selling and teaching zero waste, vegan and home made products and help me start my dream of changing the world.

What We Need & What You Get

I need at least $35,000 to buy the existing business with the stock,staff, current premises, suppliers and customers. To keep the business stocked up for the next 3 months, I'll need at least $14,000 to make it through the Christmas period and a quiet January. An extra $7,000 will be to start the refreshing process by installing bulk buying stands, getting zero waste products and setting up the initial workshops.

We have some mind-blowing perks available! Coffee for life! Meal vouchers, t-shirts, lunch for you and ten friends, children's parties, vegan cooking and zero waste workshops, and you even get to take over the shop for a weekend!

If we don't reach the entire goal, the funds will be proportioned 5:3 into buying into the business (possibly with the bank) and put towards running costs of the existing business.

The Impact

This has been my favourite café for years. A place to rest and recharge at the various beautiful locations the shop has been in over the years. I really believe they have made a huge difference and I want to take over the legacy and build on its great values. How to put into your mouth. Support farmers. Imagine a place you can go to for a quick cappuccino and also grab your organic vegetables for the week. Luxurious in taste but minimalist and functional in design. Sustainably made, minimum plastic involved, waste produced is recycled responsibly or composted. Our contribution to reducing landfill waste, reducing the impact of climate change and putting love out into the universe.

I've been a part of the organic farmer/volunteer exchange called WWOOF in South Africa since 2012. I've adopted zero waste into my home, work and lifestyle but have struggled to find products. I want to make it easy for people to adapt. I have adopted a vegan lifestyle and learnt how to make so many products at home because I couldn't find them on the shelf. I have worked for an international company which taught us to continuously improve systems and processes (kaizen) as well as to reduce inefficiency and waste. I hope to bring my personal, business and volunteer experience into one place.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risks and obstacles I may face on the way to achieving my goal.

  • Current customers may get frustrated by the stock shortages experiences and stop supporting the place.
  • Current suppliers may be nervous of changes and start finding other customers to sell to resulting in stock shortages or price increases.
  • The long standing staff members may leave taking knowledge and skills with them.

My plan to solve these challenges:

  • I hope to manage current customers expectations by contacting them with a firm date of when they can expect stock. I will also put in place a delivery option to save their travel expenses if stock gets delayed.
  • The current owner has committed to handing over by being in the shop and introducing me to her supply chain as well as helping me to get to know the existing customers with their preferences. I will have an opportunity to work with the existing staff to build up a relationship with them and to learn their ways. The owner also has back up staff to enable her staff and herself to take breaks and holidays.
  • I am very creative, love growing and making things from scratch. I have high emotional intelligence and also the adaptability to come up with solutions.
  • I am very tech literate and have good knowledge of business cycles, finance, accounting and administration.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Visit Earthmother Organic and grab something to eat or a coffee or some lovely organic produce.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, email, telephone, WhatsApp. 

Thanks for your support!

I am very tech literate and have good knowledge of business cycles, finance, accounting and administration.


Other Ways You Can Help

Visit Earthmother Organic and grab something to eat or a coffee or some lovely organic produce.
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, email, telephone, WhatsApp. 

Thanks for your support!

story:
THE BOOK: Cooking for Conservation is part cookbook, part travelogue, part detailed account of the challenges of conservation in the African bush. Jamie Sparks's beautiful new book on her experiences and time in the canvas kitchen at Camp Nomade in Tchad's Zakouma National Park takes the reader on an evocative journey into the heart of Africa, its people, flavors and incredible wildlife.

THE GOAL: Defending what's left of the natural world is no easy task – protecting the wilderness takes courage, and international NGO African Parks has made conservation their mission. This book shares that mission. $100,000 of the book’s profit will go to African Parks, and 25% of all profits will go to African Parks thereafter.

 

Tchad: Cooking for Conservation will be a beautiful cookbook/coffee table book filled with spectacular images of Zakouma National Park donated by professional guides and conservationists. Interwoven between scenes from the bush and the daily happenings at camp is a gastronomic safari. As you turn the pages, you taste your way through a week at Camp Nomade.

 

HOW IT ALL STARTED: Jamie was tasked with setting up Camp Nomade with a food experience equal to its wildlife experience. Hours were spent searching through dusty market stalls, attempting to explain to chef Abdoulaye in broken French the nuance of flavors in fine dining, and introducing the eager group of Tchadian staff to waiting tables and hosting. 

 

THE SPARK: Evenings were spent around the table with the park managers, who told stories of the passions and personalities of African Parks, the organization that rescued Zakouma's animals from poachers and helped raise the park out of decline.Inspired by her surroundings and the stories she heard, Jamie knew almost immediately that she needed to write a book about this place - this connection between food and community, between conservation and sense of place.

Ms. Sparks will be sharing her recipes, created in Camp Nomade's canvas-tented kitchen in the middle of Zakouma's dry, dusty planes. Cooling melon in vanilla syrup for when temperatures reach 45° Celsius in the middle of the day, pizzas cooked straight on the coals, sweet sesame snaps found in the sticky hands of cheeky local children, and spiced falafel served to guests out in the bush.

 

This book does a lot more than tell tales of safari: it's a book on the lighter side of Tchad, a place that is complex, enchanting, and quite unimaginable.

 

ZAKOUMA: During her time at Camp Nomade in Zakouma, these are just a few of the things Jamie came to learn: 

  • African Parks took over the management of Zakouma in 2010. By then, the situation was dire. Poachers had killed nearly 4000 elephants for their ivory. The remaining elephants were so stressed that they had stopped breeding.
  • African Parks made it a priority to set up effective law enforcement. Within two years they managed to halt elephant poaching completely.
  • The presence of African Parks doesn't just help the wildlife. The communities living around the park are now safe from the threat of violent poachers and no longer live in fear.
  • African Parks has built schools and health centers and helped set up small enterprise so that the people living around their parks see that a thriving park is a path to a better future.

AFRICAN PARKS: Zakouma's inspiring success story is not unique. African Parks has stories like this from their other parks too. Currently African Parks manages 15 parks in nine countries, making up the largest and most ecologically diverse portfolio of parks in Africa under the protection of any single NGO.

The money raised by Cooking for Conservation will help African Parks continue this amazing work in Zakouma and in every park under their care across the continent.

People are quick to give money to support majestic elephants and big cats, but what about the snakes, beetles, rodents and bats? What about funding grassland, beehives or fisheries? African Parks protects ecosystems, rather than particular species. And the money raised through Cooking for Conservation will be used with their wisdom where it is needed most.

ONGOING UPDATES: African Parks will provide regular updates on how the money donated is being utilized, which we will shared on the campaign page and on the Cooking for Conservation website, to let supporters know how their money is helping the cause.

Sign up to our newsletter to get all of our updates. 

 

SOPHY ROBERTS (foreword)

"On my first morning on safari in Chad, I trip up in an elephant's footprint. It is January 15, and I'm the first guest at Camp Nomade, a new mobile safari camp in Zakouma National Park...

We penetrate deeper into the bush, and I hear it for the first time: the trumpeting pitch, like the creak of the Earth's crust. In a small clearing emerges a phalanx of steel skins lined up like shields. Their wide ears face us – about 40 elephants in view, with many more implied in the rustle of feet... I feel the infinite possibilities of this place... I realise I have been completely seduced – by the optimism Zakouma represents..."

Sophy Roberts, writing FT Weekend 31 january 2015.

Sophy Roberts is an award-winning UK-based writer, who contributes regularly to the Financial Times, among other publications. Her stories focus on remote places, where travel meets conservation, with much of her time spent in Africa and Siberia. She visited Chad for the first time in 2015, a guest at Camp Nomade. 

Sophy has written the foreword for the Cooking for Conservation book.

KATIE DE KLEE (editor)

Katie de Klee has lived in South Africa for the last six and a half years, working as a journalist and editor. For over two years, she worked as editor in chief for Design Indaba, the largest creative platform on the African continent. Originally from England, she is passionate about travel and story telling, especially stories of how creativity can help overcome obstacles.

MICHAEL LORENTZ (contributed scene photographs)

Michael Lorentz is a prominent South African guide who believes that travel, conservation, and philanthropy is an increasingly important place and one that he feels he can play an active role in. He also cofounded and is acting CEO of Passage to Africa and he cofounded Safarious.com, a social networking site for safari-goers. 

Michael is a passionately talented photographer and when speaking to him about the book, without hesitation, he offered to hand over years of Zakouma photographs for the project. The beauty of the book is in large part thanks to his generosity.

JEAN LABUSCHAGNE (contributed scene photographs)

Jean Labuschagne is not only a dedicated conservationist, having grown up in national parks in South Africa, Malawi, and Tanzania, but she also has a keen eye for photography. Jean introduced Jamie to Tchad, African Parks, and Zakouma, where her parents acted as park manager and special projects manager. Through her captured images she manages to open your eyes to her world.

Jamie Sparks took a nine month sabbatical from work in order to write, recipe test, photograph, and format this book into something both visually pleasing, informative and fun to cook with. Once the funds from this campaign are confirmed she will proceed with a print test run, with printing and distribution to follow.  

               

                 $5 or more

No reward required, you just love wildlife or are friends with the author or contributors and want to help get this project off the ground.

               

              $10 or more

RECIPE CARDS: A menu of 5 exclusive new recipes created by Jamie Sparks, not included in the book, for you to try for your next dinner gathering. These will include a pre-dinner snack, a soup, a starter, main course, and a dessert.

Estimated delivery October 2018. Ships anywhere in the world.

 

                $12 or more

Wear your support of conservation proudly with this African Parks baseball cap.

Estimated delivery October 2018. Ships anywhere in the world.

You will have the opportunity to buy the book at a later date if the Kickstarter is successful.

               

              $20 or more

"Return of the Rhino" African Parks T-shirt

At the beginning of May, six rhinos completed a historic journey from their original home in South Africa to their new home in Zakouma National Park, reintroducing the species to the area.

African Parks made a commemorative t-shirt to mark the event and has donated a limited number to our campaign.

Available in: Ladies  large, and x-large.  Mens small. 

Estimated delivery October 2018. Ships anywhere in the world.

               

               $38 or more

Tchad: Cooking for Conservation

A first edition of Tchad: Cooking for Conservation. 

Estimated delivery November 2018. Ships anywhere in the world.

 

                 

              $60 or more

1 copy of the book and 1 custom "Cooking for Conservation" apron

A first edition copy of Tchad: Cooking for Conservation plus an apron to help keep you clean when you're in the kitchen with your new book! 

Estimated delivery November 2018. Ships anywhere in the world.

               

             $100 or more

3 copies of the book 

Receive three copies of Tchad: Cooking for Conservation. One to keep and two to give as gifts! 

Estimated delivery November 2018. Ships anywhere in the world.

story:
Sleek, Precise and Timeless

Hiku perfectly blends precision with sophistication. Its tough, CNC machined aluminum body is subtly textured to feel absolutely great in the hand, while lending any countertop an air of elegance. The matching grind cup detaches with a satisfying twist and holds up to 50 g of coffee; sufficient for 5 cups of pour over. An artfully sculpted walnut knob and machined handle make grinding a smooth and tactile experience.

Yet for all its beauty, the inside of Hiku conceals numerous unique technical innovations: a brand new, industry-first seven fluted conical burr and patent pending shaft stabilization system. These features work in conjunction with the aluminum chassis and food-safe stainless steel bearings to deliver a smooth grind that maintains perfect concentricity for absolutely class-leading grind particle size distribution.

The KANSO Seven Fluted Conical Burr, a Grounds Up Masterpiece

Our design team’s goal was to put the biggest, most efficient burrset in a handheld grinder that would still be astoundingly slim and easy to hold. We looked to Italy, Switzerland and Asia to source the ideal conical burr but finding nothing suitable, the Kanso team went back to the labs and designed its own. 

This Kanso-designed 41mm* burrset at the heart of the Hiku premium hand coffee grinder is the result of hundreds of hours of analysis, testing and prototyping. It is designed in Canada (patent pending) and available only in the Hiku premium grinder. Made of hardened, CNC machined stainless steel, it contains numerous industry firsts, including being the only burrset designed to support both perfect concentricity and weight reduction simultaneously for handheld grinder applications.

 

*Hiku has an inner burr diameter of 41 mm and an outer burr diameter of 55 mm. Other hand grinders measure their burr size by taking the larger dimension. By using our measurement metric, which gives a far truer indication of actual working size, their burrs generally range from 29 to 32 mm.

Infinitely Adjustable, Stepless Grind Size Adjustment Ring

Designed to emulate the look and feel of a premium rangefinder camera’s focus ring, Hiku’s stepless adjustment ring is yet another tactile revelation. Your eyes are naturally drawn to its precision laser etched grind size markings and the finely damped dial lets you tweak and tune your grind size effortlessly. No other grinder adjustment is stepless with an adjustment ring that falls readily at your fingertips, eliminating the messy guesswork or trial and error methods we’ve all seen and experienced before.

The grind size markings – they are purposely non-linear, allowing you even finer control of the grind size between medium to espresso fine.

This unique mechanism allows adjustment from the burr being fully closed to a grind size of up to 2.0mm throughout a rotational range of about 80 degrees. A simple twist of the damped ring allows the inner adjustment wheel to slide on a self-lubricating, non-linear ramp, providing both a smooth feel and really fine control at the middle of the range.

In a digital world, this is analog at its absolute best.

Concentric Design, Working in Unity 

Precise control of grind size requires obsessive attention to every factor that affects concentricity, alignment and positioning. Our engineers developed the stabilizing shaft to work in conjunction with the inner burr to eliminate any chance of wobble or misalignment.

We even replaced the age-old wire wound spring with a wave spring that more uniformly compresses the mechanism to maintain alignment.

Food-safe stainless steel ball bearings provide the right amount of rotational feel while ensuring the cranking torque is directly transferred through the mechanism to the coffee beans. Free play is kept to an absolute minimum through the use of multiple bearings that support a unique shaft with numerous keying features to ensure alignment and a perfect coupling of associated components. 

No Compromise on Concentricity:

  • Use of food-safe stainless steel ball bearings 
  • The first hand grinder utilizing a wave spring for uniform compression
  • Unique stabilizing shaft with numerous alignment features

Because these bearings require no lubricants, the grinds inside Hiku will never come into contact with oils or grease nor clump together, something we consider essential if Hiku is to be taken seriously by enthusiasts and coffee artisans.

Furthermore, Hiku is a handheld grinder and the feel in the hand is of utmost importance. Weight and weight distribution play a factor in feel. Our team discovered that we could simultaneously achieve perfect concentricity, alignment and weight reduction with our patented burr system. This means that although our burr is far larger than typical handheld grinders, it is not much heavier.

 

Designed for Portability

Hiku forces no compromise when you need to make coffee on-the-go. Weighing less than two pounds and far smaller than a typical 16 oz insulated water bottle, Hiku can travel where electric and other grinders cannot. The machined handle detaches from Hiku while the lid remains in-place. Slip Hiku into your backpack or duffle and everything you love about fine coffee can be enjoyed anywhere.

Kanso Coffee started with a vision to build the best coffee hardware in the industry. Unhappy with all current offerings on the market, we set out to improve what we consider to be the key failing of most hand grinders available today: the ratio of hand crank rotations per unit of grind output. With every other hand coffee grinder on the market, grinding is a lengthy process. But speed is nothing without quality.

The burr is at the heart of every grinder and Hiku is no different. Our team started by engineering a revolutionary new burr set that is both significantly bigger and substantially more efficient at converting rotational motion into finely controlled coffee grinds at an astounding rate. Where all others have turned to factories in Switzerland, Italy or China to source an off-the-shelf burrset to build their grinders around, we went straight to the labs and tested the competition instead. We benchmarked, we measured and we analyzed. Unsatisfied at what we saw and experienced, we set off to design a new custom burr from scratch.

Months later, and after countless prototypes, analysis and refinement, our burr was ready. But the journey had only started. This burr had to be housed in a manner that reflected our design objectives, and the enclosure needed to work in conjunction with the burr and the mechanism to be a complete solution. We are proud to say that we have achieved what we set out to accomplish. Along the way we filed three patents pending and the unique seven-fluted, Kanso designed and manufactured burr set is just one of a series of innovations.

 

Note: these pictures are from prototype testing to illustrate the range of grind sizes possible with Hiku.

We are a team of coffee obsessives and product designers. On a daily basis we commercialize ideas and product innovations that surprise and delight our clients and end users. With Hiku, we began with a simple idea, but that idea blossomed internally into a full fledged R&D project, and quite frankly, a labour of love. Employing our in-house team of talented engineers and product designers, we set off on a mission to develop a no-compromise device that we know all future owners will be proud to begin their day with.

Hiku is a finely tuned instrument in the world of coffee hardware. We believe that our background as professional product designers, and our passion as coffee enthusiasts have been artfully combined to offer you the most desirable hand coffee grinder available.

 

A Word from Our Founder

Hiku began as an idea in September 2016 to create the world’s best, most efficient burr — wrapped up in a hand coffee grinder that I couldn’t wait to use each and every morning. The coffee culture in my hometown of Vancouver, Canada lends itself well to being immersed in a neighborhood with high profile technology companies, plenty of makers and creatives, and of course, a well established startup culture.

My research and subsequent shopping adventures led me to conclude that there was not a single hand coffee grinder on the market that met my (admittedly high) expectations of consistent and precise grinds, beautiful aesthetics, and ease of use. My team subsequently performed more formal research and confirmed that my initial hunch was correct. Besides, hand grinders are typically slow and messy, while electric grinders sound crude and noisy. The last thing I want to do is crank for two minutes after I’ve gotten up on the wrong side of the bed!

I’m extremely excited to be putting my team’s creation out into the world and it begins with this campaign. My team is not new to product development for the consumer market or the food industry and our collective experience allowed us to achieve this vision in just over two years. I’m confident you will agree Hiku is what all coffee enthusiasts have been waiting for.

Altimus is a product design agency that partners and collaborates with inventors, startups, creative professionals and corporations of all sizes to commercialize innovations and launch businesses and brands. Located in beautiful Vancouver, Canada, it offers an exclusive and unique portfolio of industrial design, product development and electronics engineering services — all under one roof. 

Altimus was involved in every aspect of design, prototyping and engineering for the Hiku project. Along the way, numerous innovations were created, resulting in three patents pending and a truly unique product that we are proud to introduce to the world in collaboration with Kanso Coffee.

My team subsequently performed more formal research and confirmed that my initial hunch was correct. Besides, hand grinders are typically slow and messy, while electric grinders sound crude and noisy. The last thing I want to do is crank for two minutes after I’ve gotten up on the wrong side of the bed!I’m extremely excited to be putting my team’s creation out into the world and it begins with this campaign. My team is not new to product development for the consumer market or the food industry and our collective experience allowed us to achieve this vision in just over two years. I’m confident you will agree Hiku is what all coffee enthusiasts have been waiting for.Altimus is a product design agency that partners and collaborates with inventors, startups, creative professionals and corporations of all sizes to commercialize innovations and launch businesses and brands. Located in beautiful Vancouver, Canada, it offers an exclusive and unique portfolio of industrial design, product development and electronics engineering services — all under one roof. Altimus was involved in every aspect of design, prototyping and engineering for the Hiku project. Along the way, numerous innovations were created, resulting in three patents pending and a truly unique product that we are proud to introduce to the world in collaboration with Kanso Coffee.

story:
I have been in this industry for over 10 years and have worked in restaurants that have grossed $300k a year to restaurants that grossed $5mil a year. Working in the industry also taught me hard work & dedication is what’s really going to help you succeed, at times I held 2 full time jobs working about 150 hrs a week. I don’t regret any of that because it has made me the hard working individual that is asking you for your hard earned money.

Ever since I was a little kid I was always in the kitchen, looking to see what’s going on with my family and what they are cooking, why they are cooking things a certain way. I used to come up with my own BBQ sauces, probably now I would look at those sauces and laugh. If I had a choice on where I would want to be born it would most likely be in a kitchen, no matter the size the type of appliances, long as it has the basic essentials to a kitchen I would like to be born in.

Im not in this business for money, I genuinely love to see smiles on people’s faces when they eat my food. I only would want to expand my food to other cities to make more people happier with our food

$45,000 is the amount we are looking to raise. We will be using the funds to buy commercial equipment, inventory and furniture for our concept. Our perks will be like no other, we will be giving you 150% of you money back through our perks, also other perks that are really unique and still serve the purpose as you getting you money back.  If our goals  are not met we will be giving you money back, plain and simple, no questions asked.

The restaurant industry has so many risks, that’s why a lot of them go out of business. You must have great customer service, great food, fun friendly environment, efficiency, consistency and on top of all that your prices have to be reasonable. You also have to appeal to almost everybody in most restaurants, it really depends on what you are serving. You want to know the clientele that you will be around, if your next to a bar serve some bar food, if your are next to a gym maybe look into a juice section for your menu or just some healthy food options. It’s also a good idea to get the customer’s perspective, be very open to suggestions and criticisms, and that’s a very hard challenge for some people to overcome. 

Interacting with social media and creating a dialogue with your audience is very essential to being successful in this line of work, customers will take to social media to praise you food and give their criticisms. It’s the responsibility of the restaurant to acknowledge them and fix them eternally and hope they come back to experience the improvements you have made. Some customers will try something at least twice if they weren’t happy the first time, it’s the restaurant main objective to change those customers minds.

I know not everyone can contribute financially and I understand completely & respect that, I only hope you feel that this project is worth sharing on your social media platforms to help boost my chances of reaching the goal

Thank you for your time and I hope to see you at the restaurant.

story:
Short Summary

Last year, Petals only coffee shop closed down.The citizens of Petal now have to drive to Hattiesburg for their Cafe experience. We would like to open a Cafe in the heart of Petal, on a newly renovated road which is quickly becoming the most highly traveled road in the area.

We need an affordable, healthy, fun coffee/sandwich shop where people can go for a snack or for their lunch! Take a look at our Sammi & Panini Menu in the Gallery Section.

We use local ingredients for our sandwiches and paninis, fairtrade coffee from south america for all our coffee menu items and give space for local artists and craftsman to sell their gift items. Boardwalk Cafe will be a popular place to come sample the areas local fair, have a good cup of coffe and sit out on the boardwalk style patio with your friends.

The Impact

Contributors to our cause will help us open as early as June. We are hoping to raise $10,000 to buy a much needed espresso machine, and an ice machine. We have almost everything we need to open our doors. The importance of these two peices of equipment cannot be understated.
 
There is nowhere in the area, even in Hattiesburg, where someone can go buy a cup of coffee, and an affordable healthy lunch made with all-natural local ingredients. It is important to have a place where you can see where the food you are eating came from, who made it and why it tastes so delicious in addition to supporting the local economy through local farms and vendors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page with your family and friends, the more people who know about what Boradwalk Cafe is trying to do, the more people who will help.

story:
OUR DREAM

We’re starting a movement to right the wrong, ditch the plastic and return milk to glass, delivered fresh to the door every day in re-washable and refillable glass bottles.

We are small, and we don’t aspire to be too big, so if you don’t live in coastal NSW, we probably won’t be able to deliver milk to you. But we believe that when the small dairy near you sees what a little dairy half way around the world can do, you will soon get your milk in glass too. 

We’re making the start, come join the Moovement. 

 

OUR DAIRY

Big River is a small dairy farm on the Clarence River in New South Wales. Our dairy began as ﬁve small dairy plots on Lawrence Road that joined together to build a boutique pasteurisation and bottling plant. Our ambition was to return milk to being real milk just the way it should be. In the last eleven years we have worked to strip away the additives, the mixing, the blending and the over-processing of milk, and get to a point where we only give you what the cow gives to us. 

Every drop of milk we deliver comes only from the animals we have nurtured from birth. We do not buy or bottle milk from other farms or animals. That way we can guarantee the highest standard of animal welfare for our beautiful Jerseys and Fresians, and we can also guarantee that not a single additive or permeate enters our milk. 

 

LET’S GET RID OF PLASTIC

Whilst Big River Milk has won renown praise from judges and customers alike, there has been one part of our process that we have never been happy with - the use of plastic bottles. Yes, most of us have grown used to the taste of milk in plastic, however, for those lucky enough to drink milk only stored in glass the difference is pretty special. Not only does milk taste better and stay colder longer in glass, but glass is fully reusable, fully recyclable and does not add to landﬁll. 

The move away from plastic is worthwhile, but it will be a substantial investment. We are calling on the like-minded to get behind us and help us achieve our goal for producing real milk without the plastic. To get our dream off the ground we need to purchase the initial stock of bottles and upgrade most elements of our bottling and distribution process. We need to install specialist systems to clean the bottle, meet the stringent health and safety regulations, and lastly upgrade all of our trucks to withstand the additional weight of transporting the heavier glass bottles. 

THE IMPACT 

The starting point is the removal 137,520 plastic bottles per annum out of the supply chain. If we replaced every plastic bottle from our supply chain it would be 500,000 bottles per year. If we can encourage other independents by showing what is possible it could be 100's of millions of bottles each year.

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET.

We need $419,500 to convert our process to glass. We have raised $220,000 and are hoping to get like-minded supporters to help us raise $199,500

As for what you get, for people that we can ship to – those living between Tweed Heads through to Port Macquarie - we would simply ask for you to just subscribe to our home delivery service at the same price you would pay for your everyday milk. For those of you that we cannot reach with our trucks, we have put together a selection of little items to support our cause. 

 

THE OPEN SOURCE MOOVEMENT

We are documenting the processes and the challenges of making the change to glass. These are available freely to other independent milk producers for a smoother and lower-cost way of changing over.

story:
Campaña en ESPAÑOL AQUI


INVITE

Can you imagine a self-sufficient, resilient & zero waste restaurant? With organic, plant based, non-GMO foods?  Well, Flora Restaurante Permacultural  is becoming that space. It began almost 3 years ago, in January 2016 in Quito-Ecuador, by a young loving couple Paulette and Josué, whom together have created over 600 non-repeated delicious menus, multiple cultural events and workshops, where guests from diverse cultures have enjoyed plenty.

We invite you to be part  a regenerating movement, please donate! Your donation to this campaign will help FLORA grow the project and the community, improve service, provide delicious healthy food to thousands of local and international guests, and to become an urban example of a regenerative project to Ecuador and the rest of the World.
 


*******************************

Campaña en ESPAÑOL AQUI


Paulette & Josué; 

Are an inspiring loving couple that teamed up as working partners, gathered a community to teamed up with them, in order to produce some of the most amazing projects that help regenerate life and help transform lives. Learn a little more about this beautiful couple below:

 


Paulette Ordoñez, 

Ecuadorian, was born with natural "sazón" for traditional Ecuadorian cuisine, has traveled to Italy, United States and countries of south america, like Peru and Chile, where her taste for diverse cultures has evolved into be able to creatively design hundreds of menus years round, without animal products and make it extremely delicious. Paulette graduated with honors in Communication: Sustainable Development in Salesiana University in Quito - Ecuador, as well as completed an International Permaculture Design Course (PDC) in Centro Tinku Escuela de Permacultura .  Today, while she helps FLORA grow, she produces other regenerative projects with her husband Josué. Her main focus is to work hard building an eco-village in the Amazon Jungle called Sikuanga Eco-Village, with the local Kichwa community in Canelos, Pastaza. She also has research studies in Tantra meditation and is passionate about singing, dancing, theater, clothing design and more. Paulette, practices a plant-based diet since 2012. 

 

Josué Daniel Saenz Negrete, 

also Ecuadorian, who has lived in San Francisco, California, and traveled to Oregon, Nevada, Florida, Texas, Mexico, Romania, Spain, Colombia, Costa Rica and more. Working 16 years in restaurants, 11 years in festival & event production and 5 years studying Permaculture. 

In 2014, Josué got inspired and decided to move back to Ecuador to take action producing regenerative projects; where next to his wife Paulette, they created Flora Restaurant Permacultural, Tropicana Productions, Festival SEEDS and currently building Sikuanga Eco-Village.  Josué,  studied college at CCSF (City College of San Francisco) to become an engineer in renewable energy, until Permaculture came a long and had to "drop out" of college to study 4 years at UPISF (Urban Permaculture Institute of San Francisco) to officially become an International Permaculture Designer. Also studied one year of permaculture in Ecuador, with the Red de Guardianes de Semillas (RGS). Moreover, since 2008, Josué began a plant-based diet, doing his own nutritional research in veganism, macriobiotic, ayurveda and more. Today, aside from establishing holistic systems in his life, Josué is passionate about the human mind and the realm of Consciousness. Enjoys, dancing, singing and sleeping.

**************************************

Campaña en ESPAÑOL AQUI


YOUR DONATIONS

You donate and we gift you with awesome "perks"; from delicious & healthy organic, plant-based and non-GMO foods, to courses and transformational experiences as well as amazing TOURS in Ecuador, to the Amazon Jungle, Coast or Sierra. You may also pick TOURS in the San Francisco - Bay Area  in California.


Where are your donations going?


$25,0000 represents energy, and Flora will turn that energy into productive, efficient and regenerative energy. Money contributions from an entire community & family will be used wisely and eficcient, and is broken down into the following:

$10,000

ROOFTOP CHANGE & WATER HARVESTING

  • February: Analisis & Base Map
  • March: Design and Finance
  • April: Permits
  • June: Getting Started
  • July - August: 8 Week Constructions & Renovation

NOTE: A complete 3D  visual  Architectural and Permacultural design is coming up soon... 

 

$10,000

KITCHEN EQUIPMENT

  • September: Design and Finance
  • October: Instalation and Training

The following video is produced by CaterPlanUK which is a very close example of how we need the kitchen in FLORA to be renovated into. 

 

$5,000

EXTRA COSTS

  • Production Costs
  • Coordinating Costs
  • Unexpected Costs

 

$10,000

EXTRA DONATIONS

  • Digital Restaurant Operation System
  • 2 Computers and Printers
  • Walk-in Refrigerator



**************************************

FLORA CREW


Natural Building Team

Mateo Aguirre.- Architect / Bio-construction

Juan Sebastián Pérez.- Civil Engineer

 

Communication Team

Cristina Camacho.- Community Manager, Graphic Designer, Event Producer

Salomón Andrade.- Communication Manager, Graphic Design and illustrator

Jessica Tupiza.- Community Manager & Communication

 

Visual Arts Team

Mayri Hidalgo.- Art Design, illustrator and Graphic Designer

Paolo Acevedo.- Art illustrator


Video & Photography

Andrés Viera (Documencia) Video & Edit

Gustavo Chiriboga  Video & Edit
 

Sound Team

Joel Ordoñez.- Event Producer

 

Finance & Accounting Team

Emilio León .- Finance, Accounting, Front of the House

 

Plant - Based Kitchen Team

Paulette Ordoñez.- Menu Design and Lead Cook

Carla Enriquez.- Sous Chef, Pastry Chef

Gabriela Bedón.- Sous Chef

 

Operations Team

Paulette Ordoñez.- General Coordinator, Permaculture Designer, Event Designer

Josué Daniel Saenz Negrete.- General Coordinator, Permaculture Designer, Event Designer

Laura Vasconez.- Event Coordinator

story:
About this campaign

Japanese snacks, like all Japanese food, have a reputation for being awesome/quirky. Flavors, shapes, and even colors we'd never and we want to share their snacks around the world. Each month we will lovingly put together a box filled with a different selection of the yummiest Japanese snacks and send them straight to you.

Currently there 2 subscription plan, which will contains treats from Japan including chips / candy / chocolate / cup noodles / biscuits etc... 

What We Need & What You Get

YUMMY BOX (small)  
1 x chip bag 
1 x candy bag 
2-3 popular snacks 
1-2 dagashi snacks 
1 x snack guide 

OSHI BOX (large) 
1 x mystery snack 
1 x cup noodle 
2 x chip bag
2 x candy bag 
3-4 popular snacks 
1-2 dagashi snacks 
1 x snack guide 

FREE shipping only applies to USA at the moment. (but we hope to expand FREE shipping countries in the future)

 This Campaign will run 18 days and we will start ship our first box in mid-Septemeber.

Risks & Challenges

There already so many japan snack subscription box online, and we want to stand out from the rest (with a good prices) , we want to share more unique snack with you guys, we have lots of idea and this campaign is our first step.

There absolutely no risk for this campaign, we have all sources for Japanese snack suppliers , once this campaign fully funded, we will start shipping out the box!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

OSHI BOX (large) 1 x mystery snack 1 x cup noodle 2 x chip bag2 x candy bag 3-4 popular snacks 1-2 dagashi snacks 1 x snack guide 
FREE shipping only applies to USA at the moment. (but we hope to expand FREE shipping countries in the future) This Campaign will run 18 days and we will start ship our first box in mid-Septemeber.

Risks & Challenges
There already so many japan snack subscription box online, and we want to stand out from the rest (with a good prices) , we want to share more unique snack with you guys, we have lots of idea and this campaign is our first step.There absolutely no risk for this campaign, we have all sources for Japanese snack suppliers , once this campaign fully funded, we will start shipping out the box!!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is energetic Morning?

Energetic Morning is a nootropic energy drink that will help you wake up early and get most out of your days. The carefully chosen ingredients will boost your energy levels, increase mental focus and help your body hydrate. 

 
 

Risks & Guarantees

100% Guaranteed: if for any reason I can not produce the final product I will refund everyone's money. I do not foresee any issues that would stop me from being able to complete the project, but if something outside my control happens and I can't produce the project I will refund everyone their money.

Let's make Energetic Morning Happen!

By supporting our Indiegogo you are getting a special discounted price that will only be available during this Indiegogo launch. By making your purchase you are helping to fund our first production run, and helping spread the knowledge of waking up early to the world. Time are tough right now, and staying home can be challenging! I just hope that I can help make these tough times a little more enjoyable and a positive light in your life!

story:
Backstory of the Invention

Our idea for a fun seasoning mix company was inspired by all those expensive unused seasonings sitting in pantries going expired. Seasoning mixes at the grocery store haven’t changed in decades! We wanted a meal helper we could recommend or pick up for an easy healthy delicious large one-pot hearty meal. Thinking of our own families, we wanted to create a way to reduce the confusion, waste, and disappointment of traditional cooking and give everyone a shortcut to the vibrant flavors we know and love. 

Before starting Broth Bomb™, I owned and operated the top restaurant delivery service in Tampa Bay, only to be struck down with a physical disability and chronic gastric diseases. With limited resources and mobility, I found simple ways to enjoy familiar cuisines without sacrificing taste or convenience.  I've lived the food desert life (poverty), self-studied food sciences, nutrition sciences, and reversed several diseases. Nicknamed hot dog as a kid, we gave our child the middle-name Bean, because they saved my life.  So, it's even more fitting that we would go on to create a patent-pending seasoning mix for bean stews; a pop-culture catalyst for easy delicious recipes.  Now, with Broth Bomb™, everyone can become a bean stew expert.

(Owner Andrew Laurent)

 

What We Need & What You Get

We already had a small successful campaign and just shipped our first orders. The margins we slim and we need more pre-sales from people ike you on the leading edge of culture and marketplaces. We already have a facility, permits, process, and staff trained.

 

 

Stone Soup Story

A traveler comes to a village. She unpacks a giant cooking pot. Then goes to a stream and fills the pot with water, drops a large stone in it, and places it over a fire. The villagers become curious and ask what they are doing. The traveler answers that they are making "stone soup", which tastes wonderful and which they would be delighted to share, although it still needs a little bit of garnish, which they are missing, to improve the flavor. 

The first villager, who anticipates enjoying a share of the soup, does not mind parting with a few carrots and adds them to the pot. Another villager hands them a little bit of cabbage. More and more villagers walk by, each adding another ingredient. Finally, the stone is removed from the pot, and a delicious and nourishing pot of soup is enjoyed by everyone. 

This old folk story highlights what we are trying to do at Broth Bomb™. Long before we perfected our recipes we cooked soups and stews with this sort of, whatever is on hand, strategy… and always cooking enough to share. Not every attempt came out great but they were always nourishing. Through these experiences we developed some amazing recipes. 

Today's hungry travelers from this story are people living in poverty in food deserts that don't have access to fresh produce. We all chip in to help those in poverty but instead of a nutritious pot of food, due to their limited access, they end up with something much less healthy. Part of our mission is to show that with only canned foods found at corner stores, along with our product as the “stone soup” catalyst, that nutritious hearty stews are accessible to nearly every person. 

We plan to offer our products at great discount to the small shops that are used by a large number of families suffering from this food desert phenomenon. This won't solve the problem of affordable access to fresh produce, we just hope to help make healthy meals more accessible to everyone.

Pledge now!

You will absolutely enjoy the experience and the flavors. Please follow us on Instagram, YouTube, and Facebook. Don't forget to share this with all your friends and followers! Click that Indiegogo share button too.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Being physically disabled, I had to overcome extreme obstacles to launch this company. We have made and shipped products; we just need new funds to order more ingredients. We are building a team of people to insure the success of Broth Bomb™.

story:
We all know it feels good to be hydrated and that it’s good for us, but here are some details of how it benefits your body.  

Humans are 70% water. A lack of consumption of water leads to the dehydration of our cells, which can contribute to lower cognitive function and ultimately diabetes, high cholesterol, and a rise in blood pressure.

This is why it’s important that we do everything we can to get that precious H2O into our systems. 

We know that some people find it quite boring...

 

However...

Add sugar? Sugar can lead to weight gain as well as all kinds of other health problems. Isn't there a healthier option? 

What about sparkling water?

What?

Drinking sparkling water not only quenches your thirst, it also makes you less likely to drink sugary carbonated beverages. That’s because a lot of what people crave in a soda or other carbonated drink is actually the bubbly texture, not the sugar. 

Researchers have found that not only are people enjoying the carbonation revolution-but that giving your water a bit of texture, that extra kick, is increasing the amount of water that people take in.

Source: A survey done by Toluna

 

Bubbles make it better, and companies have been bottling sparkling water for a long time, so we’re all used to having them around; they're everywhere, and easy to get.

But what about the environment?

Plastic bottles are such an integrated part of our landscape that we barely notice them anymore, but they’re all over the place. On shelves, in homes, and ultimately as garbage that gets sent to landfills or ends up littering our forests and oceans. 

Despite recycling schemes being commonplace worldwide, less than half of all plastic bottles are actually recycled. Waste plastic is poisoning our land and air as it is dumped in landfills or burned, but the largely unseen victims of discarded plastic waste are in our oceans, where marine life is endangered by the rising volume of floating plastic. 

It’s up to us to decide the legacy we want to leave behind. Will we contribute to the growing landfills and the trash island in the Pacific Ocean (or anywhere else), or will we take the high road and choose conservation?  

That’s probably not the best idea.

Fizzing Bottle is not just a bottle; it’s an all-in-one on-the-go carbonation, hydration machine.

Two lids, one super-compressed air chamber, total satisfaction.

Pour, click, and fizz.

The carbonation system is right in the bottle! With a handheld carbonation kit, you can truly take control of what goes into your body.

Wherever you are, indoors or outdoors, on an adventure or relaxing at home, Fizzing Bottle fits your hand, in your bag, or even slides into the drinks holder on your bike. With such simplistic design and ease of use, it's hard to believe this bottle contains a state of the art carbonation system. It also opens at both ends to clean, refill, and dispense your beverage with no fuss. 

STEP 1

Insert a carbonation cartridge. 

STEP 2

Twist, fizz, and enjoy.

Medical Grade Stainless Steel #316

Medical grade stainless steel is not only resistant to dents and leaks, it also doesn’t absorb flavor, so you can rest assured that the beverage you put in will be exactly what you taste, however long it’s in the bottle.

Easy-Twist Knob

Plug in the CO2, twist, and fizz. If you’re looking to get a quick fix, we’ve got you covered, and with no need to return to the kitchen and make more.

Vacuum Insulated Walls

Maintain beverage temperature and prevent moisture from getting where it shouldn’t be. No worries in the “staying dry” department.

Two Ends

Pour, mix, and clean with ease. Thanks to the stainless steel, you can easily toss it into the dishwasher and save yourself some work. 

People use more than 500 billion plastic bottles a year.

Just one universal eight-gram CO2 cartridge can put the fizz in 2400ml of water. What’s more, each cartridge costs fifty cents, whereas that amount of bottled sparkling water will cost you eight bucks! With our unique fixed dosage design, the Fizzing Bottle pays for itself in no time.

1 Cartridge = 4 Fizzes!

Hydrate yourself, keep your wallet in check, and ultimately contribute your part to saving the world.

You can pick your color, fit your flavor, and design it yourself to fit your taste. Your lifestyle has its own needs, and its own look. Make it as unique as you are. Add accessories and stickers. Your look, your choice.

Whether it’s gone flat or just needs a kick, you can carbonate or re-carbonate your beverage to your liking. Just like the outside, you also pick what’s on the inside. Add flavors that get you moving and excite your taste buds.

The Fizzing Bottle is the first product of its kind to offer you the fizzy satisfaction of beverages that would normally require a trip to the convenience store or the use of an at-home carbonation device.

No large machines, no fuss, no extra costs or waste.

Not into carbonated drinks? Well we have good news for you! With nitrogenous beverages, you can get that creamy satisfaction anytime. The Fizzing Bottle is also compatible with nitrogen cartridges, which fit the same 8g spot in the Fizzing Bottle, you can have creamy tea, nitro cold brew, juice or liquor anytime! 

 

Dual-ended, easy cleaning, convenient. All the features of the Fizzing Bottle but the Fizz.

The Fizzing Bottle is your go-to source of satisfying hydration, satisfaction, and a spicing-up of your daily routine.

As for us, our team makes up a small company with big ideas.

Fizzing Cool Ltd., as cool as its name, aims to inspire everyone’s inner health-nut. Through active hydration, we hope to help you maintain the fuel to explore the world around you, partake in your favorite activities, and keep up with the pace of modern life. Active people motivate us, and in turn, we hope to stimulate them to benefit their wellness through easy access to their favorite refreshments. Quick, convenient, and multi-functional products are our goal, and we hope you’re as excited as we are about interacting with them in the future.

Since Fizzing Cool was first founded, we’ve taken it as our mission to spread the idea of sparkling drinks as a healthy lifestyle choice. We aim to help people maintain their well-being, anytime, anywhere, simply by drinking more water, and to make drinking water more fun than ever.

 

 

All businesses face the possibility of delays caused by events such as late arrivals of large orders, supplier emergencies, and other unforeseen factors. This also applies to the Fizzing Cool, especially since we are working on providing the best portable soda making experience, as well as the durability and your safety. We will continue to take proper measures to stabilize production and delivery of Fizzing Bottle. By working directly with our deliberately-selected manufacturers, we are decreasing the risks from the supplier aspect.

Fitting the entire soda making station to such a small portable bottle is an ambitious undertaking, but we hope that you will not hesitate to join us. We look forward to hitting the stretch goals with your support!

story:
UPDATES are here, which should answer some questions you may be having: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/decanting-club-exploring-wine-a-glass-at-a-time/x/12742531#/updates


Here's what we have planned

Decanting Club is a subscription-based service offering participants the chance to try new wines, one glass at a time.

Every week, Decanting Club will send subscribers a pouch containing a glass-full (150ml) of specially selected wine. Using the free Decanting Club app, subscribers can learn more about the wines, read tasting notes and share their comments with like-minded people. Video presentations made by Decanting Club’s in-house wine expert also feature on the app from time to time.

The service is planned to launch in February 2016. Decanting Club will offer a choice of three different levels of subscription which customers can sign up for on a monthly basis, or buy as gifts for others. Prices will start from £15 per month.

Who's it for?

Decanting Club caters to people who are keen to learn more about wines but are put off by the expense. They select wines from unexpected countries and those made from less well-known grapes and ground-breaking production methods. They’re superior in quality to supermarket wines, yet offer excellent value for money. Subscribers can then purchase more of the wine, directly from Decanting Club, if they wish.

With the various studies finding recently that men and women who drink a small amount of wine regularly have a lower risk of heart failure, Decanting Club’s one glass a week approach offers a unique way to capitalise on these health benefits.

What's happening now?

As we are in the run-up to Christmas, we have decided to build the IndieGoGo perks around our gift certificates, which allows people to buy the Decanting Club experience for others (or themselves!) in the easiest possible way. The certificates will entitle recipients to a three, six or twelve month subscription.

All but the first of the perks on the right of the screen will result in a Welcome Package being created. This will be sent to the address of your choice in time for Christmas. The pack will contain a certificate which the recipient will use to register with Decanting Club in the New Year. The pack will also contain more information about the club and how it works.

The person who receives this gift for Christmas not only gets to enjoy all the benefits of Decanting Club, but has the excitement of being a founder member as well!

A note from the founders

Thanks for looking at our page. We are very excited to be so close to launching Decanting Club.

We have taken our idea through two separate trials and both have gone extremely well. Each time we've taken the feedback we have received and refined the service and now we feel it is ready for prime time!

In order to successfully launch Decanting Club we need a substantial number of initial subscribers. This allows us the buying power to source better wines at keener prices and will therefore lead to a better experience for those initial subscribers. For this reason we have decided to launch using IndieGoGo.

Please take a look at our website (http://decanting.club), view the video above and if you can, purchase a gift certificate. Even if you can't do that, please tell everyone you know (via email, Facebook, Twitter etc) about the project. It is only through word of mouth that we can get the exposure we need to make Decanting Club a reality.

Thank you, for your support.

Paul, Vince, Ben & Steve


Challenges

There are 5 stages to the process of getting a different wine every week to every subscriber, and each has its own challenges.

1. Sourcing

The club needs to source good quality wines that are from obscure countries or with interesting grapes or production methods. Wines that are more interesting and better quality than those usually found at the supermarket. These wines are more expensive and so we need to balance the cost of those against giving good value for money for subscribers. As we grow, this will become easier due to economies of scale, but it is certainly a challenge for us at the beginning.

We are currently in discussions with a number of specialised UK importers of wine. In the near future we also intend to source directly from producers and wineries around the world.

2. Decanting

We need to extract the wine from bottles into pouches and then seal them, all in a way that minimises air contact with the wine. Currently we have a fairly resource-intensive process to achieve this, but it worked well in our initial trials. However as the club grows we will need to automate the process to make it more efficient.

3. Sending

We have been through a number of different pouch designs and are still working on the final one which will be used for launch. The pouch needs to be easily filled, and sealed. It needs to be strong enough to withstand the rigours of the Post Office and also look attractive and be easy to pour once it reaches it destination.

4. Tasting

A large technical infrastructure needs to be put in place in order to make the app and website work seamlessly week-on-week. A back-end system needs to allow customer-management, stock control and population of the website and app. A lot of the work for this was done for the trials, but plenty more needs to be done to make it a robust and scalable solution.

5. Purchasing

The main issue here relates to ordering stock in advance, so that purchasers can get their wine promptly, versus having unsold stock filling up our offices. We need to strike a good compromise between these two.
